intro: Saussurea tsinlingensis, commonly known as the Tsingling safflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, often found in mountainous regions with cool climates. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
